results.title: Casey
results.creator_credit: Neil Munro, Tom Haydon and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: This film is a view of the life and career of the former Governor-General of Australia, Lord Casey. It is the first film about Lord Casey and covers the span of years from his birth in Brisbane in 1890 to his installation as a Knight of Garter at Windsor Castle nearly eighty years later. Following on from his political career which included such appointments as Treasurer in the Lyons government, Minister of Supply and Development in the first Menzies government, six years of World War II as the first Australian Minister to the United States and eventually Minister for External Affairs, Lord Casey finally became Governor-General of Australia in 1966. Photographers: Les Wesley, John Atkinson, Ron Bollman, David Brill.

results.title: Case of the hidden factor
results.creator_credit: Stanley Dalby, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Discusses the scope for improvement of storage and handling methods in industry, showing examples of good and poor practice, and the work of the National Materials Handling Bureau in the field.

results.title: Casablanca. - 50th anniversary ed. (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz, Hal B Wallis and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Humphrey Bogart and Ingrid Bergman portray former lovers briefly reunited amid the chaos of World War II. The film tells of the lonely owner of a nightclub in Nazi-occupied Casablanca and of the brief return of his former lover fleeing the Nazis with her resistance-hero husband. Only Bogart can help them escape, but he refuses…until Ilsa reawakens his idealism. Also stars Paul Henreid, Claude Rains, Sydney Greenstreet, Peter Lorre and Conrad Veidt. To commemorate “Casablanca’s” 50th anniversary the film has been restored and digitally remastered. Also included is a documentary on the making of this classic, “You must remember this” narrated by Lauren Bacall, as well as the original theatrical trailer.

results.title: Casablanca (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz, Hal B Wallis and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Humphrey Bogart and Ingrid Bergman portray former lovers briefly reunited amid the chaos of World War II. The film tells of the lonely owner of a nightclub in Nazi-occupied Casablanca and of the brief return of his former lover fleeing the Nazis with her resistance-hero husband. Only Bogart can help them escape, but he refuses…until Ilsa reawakens his idealism. Also stars Paul Henreid, Claude Rains, Sydney Greenstreet, Peter Lorre and Conrad Veidt. An all-time classic. This version of the film has been restored and digitally remastered. Also included is a documentary on the making of this classic, “You must remember this”, narrated by Lauren Bacall, as well as the 1942 original theatrical trailer and the 1992 re-issue theatrical trailer, and an all-new introduction by Lauren Bacall.

results.title: Casablanca
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz, Hal B Wallis and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Popular wartime film made in the classic Warner Studios gritty style by director Michael Curtiz, with a wonderful cast including Humphrey Bogart and Ingrid Bergman playing ill-fated lovers Rick and Ilsa. The story is set in Rick’s Café in Vichy controlled Casablanca which has become a gateway to America for desperate refugees escaping wartorn Europe. Others in the cast include Paul Henreid, Sydney Greenstreet, Peter Lorre, Conrad Veidt and Claude Rains who delivers some of the most memorable lines in a particularly witty script by Phillip and Julius Epstein and Howard Koch.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Curtiz, Hal B Wallis and Warner Bros Pictures

results.title: Casa de los babys
results.creator_credit: John Sayles, Lemore Syvan, Alejandro Springall, Syvan, Springall Pictures and Blue Magic Pictures
results.brief_description:
Low key effort from esteemed director John Sayles, who in this ensemble drama, explores the issues of adoption of South American babies by Northern American women. The story centres around six women who are impatiently passing time, awaiting a child to take home with them. Each character, filled with anticipation (and some with fear), discusses their new role as mother, reflecting upon their pasts, revealing key moments that lead them to this point. Sayles also devotes some narrative time to the story of a young impoverished boy and his depressing milieu, a pregnant teenager and her overbearing mother, a cleaning woman raising her siblings and a hotel manager and her errant son. Multiple story threads dilutes the emotional impact, but fine acting and some sticky social issues provide the film with occasional potency.
Cast includes: Daryl Hannah, Lili Taylor, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Mary Steenburgen

results.title: Cary Grant: the leading man
results.creator_credit: Gene Feldman, Suzette Winter and Wombat Productions, Inc.
results.brief_description: Born Alexander Archibald Leech in Bristol, England 1904, the son of working class parents. Always interested in acting and the theatre, Cary rose to fame after being discovered by Mae West. Her confidence in the young man she befriended paid off when Cary overcame his humble beginnings to become a favourite Hollywood icon, whose resume of films include ‘Bringing Up Baby’, ‘An Affair to Remember’, ‘His Girl Friday’ and ‘North by Northwest’. This documentary highlights the highs and lows of his career and uses family photos, archival footage and clips from his films to show the many faces of one of Hollywood’s most admired male actors. Includes interviews with friends and colleagues including: Leslie Caron; Douglas Fairbanks Jr; Deborah Kerr; Eva Marie Saint; Ralph Bellamy; Stanley Donen; Richard Brooks and Stanley Kramer.

results.title: Carving Techniques and Projects
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the basics of gouge and chisel work, discussing the choice of tools, ideas and how to adjust designs. Shows how to carve the hallmark of 18th century furniture: the classic scallop shell.
results.description: Demonstrates the basics of gouge and chisel work, discussing the choice of tools, ideas and how to adjust designs. Shows how to carve the hallmark of 18th century furniture: the classic scallop shell.

results.title: Carved in ivory
results.creator_credit: Michael Gill, Arts Council of Great Britain and Concord Films
results.brief_description: Examines small ivory sculptures created by anonymous masters from 700-1200 A.D. Much of their work decorates devotional objects such as croziers, crosses and caskets and their themes are mainly religious. Includes carvings from collections in Brunswick, Brussels, Copenhagen, Munich, Paris and New York besides a number from the Victoria and Albert and other museums in Britain. Describes these art objects in their historical and artistic context. Narrated by Sir Kenneth Clark.
